alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Inland Kenedy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 7:56AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kenedy and northeastern Brooks Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 755 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ricardo, or 9 miles southwest of Kingsville, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Falfurrias, Sarita, Pleasant Park, La Colonia Park, Airport Road Addition, Kenedy County Sheriffs Office, Falfurrias Fire Station, Flowella, Brooks County Airport and Brooks County Detention Center. This includes the following highways... US Highway 77 between mile markers 712 and 720. US Highway 281 near mile marker 710. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
